title: Learned Helplessness: When Motivation Dies
description: A fast breakdown of Learned Helplessness: When Motivation Dies for builders.

hook.text: After repeated failure they couldn't control, dogs stopped tryingâ€”even when escape became possible.

buildup.text: Martin Seligman discovered 'learned helplessness' in the 1960s through ethically troubling animal studies.

discovery.text: Humans develop it too: students who repeatedly fail begin to believe effort is pointless.

twist.text: Seligman later revised: helplessness is actually the brain's defaultâ€”hope must be learned.

climax.text: Breaking helplessness requires small, controllable successes that rebuild agency.

punchline.text: Helplessness is learned. So is hope.

quiz.question: How is learned helplessness reversed?
options: Through small, controllable successes that rebuild a sense of agency
By increasing the difficulty of tasks further
It cannot be reversed once established
